dieu.noiDung: This document regulates the use of facilities and information resources under the management of the University's Information and Library Center to serve readers' learning and research needs.
These regulations apply to all individuals and organizations using library services, as well as all staff and employees working at the Library.

dieu.tenDieu: Regulations on Library Cards and Their Use

khoan.noiDung: Readers may use one of the following two types of cards to access library services.

diem.noiDung: Student, trainee, or postgraduate cards issued by university units, integrated with library access functions.
Library-issued cards for readers who do not have multifunctional cards.

khoan.noiDung: Library cards must not be lent or used by others. Cardholders are responsible for all materials borrowed using their cards.
The validity of multifunctional cards corresponds to the learnerâ€™s study duration; library-issued cards are valid for 6 months and may be extended when necessary.
Readers must present a valid card and store personal belongings before entering the reading room.
Readers may retrieve materials from shelves themselves but must not take them out of the reading room.
Readers must not change the position of materials or take more than two books or one type of newspaper or magazine at a time.
Group discussions must be conducted at an appropriate volume without causing noise disturbance.
Before leaving, readers must return the ticket and locker key and retrieve their library card.
Materials allowed for home borrowing include textbooks and reference materials.
The maximum number of borrowed items depends on the reader category.
Deposit policies are implemented in accordance with university regulations.
Readers must check the condition of materials before borrowing.
Extensions must be requested when needed; late returns or lost books are handled according to regulations.
Prohibited substances and flammable or explosive materials are not allowed in the Library.
Readers are not allowed to install or modify library computers without permission.
Readers are responsible for preserving library materials and property and must comply with inspections when required.
Before graduation, withdrawal, or job transfer, all borrowed materials must be returned and any penalties settled.
Readers must comply with intellectual property laws when using library materials.
Unauthorized copying of library materials is prohibited.
Readers must maintain proper workplace culture, dress appropriately, and keep shared spaces clean.
Accessing inappropriate or harmful online content is prohibited.
Writing, drawing, or placing feet on tables and chairs is not allowed.

dieu.noiDung: Readers may access available digital resources on the library website.
Readers must comply with copyright and intellectual property regulations when using digital resources.
The Library encourages and rewards readers who actively and responsibly use library services.

khoan.noiDung: Lending cards or removing materials from the reading room results in suspension of library services for one month.
Causing noise or unsanitary conditions may result in suspension from one week to one month.
Damaging library materials or property requires compensation in accordance with regulations.
Serious violations are handled in accordance with institutional regulations and the law.

dieu.noiDung: These regulations take effect from the date of issuance and may be amended when necessary.
